theories.name: Communities of Practice (Wenger)
theories.rationale: Your model already captures movement from periphery to core via Skill up and Promotion Rate, with mentorship and documentation as supports. However, CoP emphasizes legitimacy of participation and the capacity constraints of mentoring that enable or throttle newcomer progression. Adding onboarding and mentoring-capacity elements introduces the balancing loops (legitimate peripheral participation and mentoring load) that prevent unrealistic growth, while strengthening the reinforcing learning loop via engagement.

variables.name: Newcomer Onboarding Rate
variables.description: Rate at which potential community members become New Contributors through initial engagement and acceptance.

variables.name: Newcomer Acceptance
variables.description: Degree to which the community legitimizes peripheral participation (norms, openness, governance).

variables.name: Mentorship Availability
variables.description: Effective availability of mentoring support given mentor capacity and newcomer load.

variables.name: New Contributor Participation Intensity
variables.description: Average effort/engagement level of New Contributors, affecting how quickly they learn by participation.

theories.name: Nonaka's SECI Model
theories.rationale: The model includes implicit and explicit knowledge transfer but lacks the knowledge stocks and conversion processes central to SECI. Introducing explicit and tacit knowledge stocks with externalization, internalization, and decay flows makes knowledge creation, reuse, and loss endogenous. This enables turnover-driven tacit knowledge loss and documentation obsolescence to shape learning and promotion dynamics, while a shared context (Ba) raises conversion effectiveness.

variables.name: Project Explicit Knowledge Base
variables.description: Accumulated documentation, guides, and formalized design knowledge available to contributors.

variables.name: Externalization Rate
variables.description: Rate at which tacit knowledge is documented into explicit artifacts (docs, guides, design notes).

variables.name: Knowledge Obsolescence Rate
variables.description: Rate at which explicit knowledge becomes outdated or invalid.

variables.name: Project Tacit Knowledge
variables.description: Shared, embodied know-how distributed across contributors (practices, heuristics, norms).

variables.name: Tacit Knowledge Formation Rate
variables.description: Rate at which tacit knowledge grows via socialization (mentoring) and internalization of explicit knowledge.

variables.name: Tacit Knowledge Loss Rate
variables.description: Rate at which tacit knowledge is lost due to developer turnover and forgetting.

variables.name: Ba (Shared Context Quality)
variables.description: Quality of shared context (tools, rituals, forums) that enables effective knowledge conversion.
